text: The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said: 'Actions are but by intentions, and every man shall have only that which he intended.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'None of you truly believes until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The strong believer is better and more beloved to Allah than the weak believer...'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Modesty is a branch of faith.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The best of you are those who learn the Qur’an and teach it.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Make things easy, not difficult. Give glad tidings, and do not drive people away.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Purity is half of faith.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Let whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day speak good or remain silent.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Smiling in the face of your brother is charity.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Verily, Allah does not look at your appearance or wealth, but He looks at your hearts and deeds.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Help your brother, whether he is an oppressor or the oppressed...'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The strong is not the one who overcomes others by his strength, but the strong is the one who controls himself while in anger.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Truthfulness leads to righteousness, and righteousness leads to Paradise.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Supplication is worship.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Exchange gifts, for it will increase your love for one another.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Allah is gentle and loves gentleness in all things.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Feed the hungry, visit the sick, and free the captive.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'When a Muslim visits his sick brother, he is harvesting the fruits of Paradise until he returns.'

The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'You will not enter Paradise until you believe, and you will not believe until you love one another. Shall I tell you something which will make you love one another? Spread peace (salam) between yourselves.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'He is not one of us who does not show mercy to our young and respect to our elders.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Do not envy one another, do not inflate prices for one another, do not hate one another...'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Whenever gentleness is in a thing, it beautifies it; and when it is removed, it disfigures it.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Charity does not decrease wealth...'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'All the sons of Adam are sinners, but the best of sinners are those who repent.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The world is cursed, everything in it is cursed, except the remembrance of Allah and what is conducive to that.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The world is a prison for the believer and a paradise for the disbeliever.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Be in this world as if you were a stranger or a traveler along a path.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Beware of suspicion, for suspicion is the worst of false tales...'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'He who does not thank people, does not thank Allah.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever remains patient, Allah will make him patient. Nobody can be given a blessing better and greater than patience.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Your body has a right over you...'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'I used to forbid you from visiting graves, but now you should visit them...'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'O people! Spread the salam, feed the hungry, maintain kinship, and pray at night while others sleep...'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Paradise lies under the feet of mothers.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'O Allah, let me live poor, die poor, and be resurrected among the poor.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Do you know what backbiting is? ... It is saying something about your brother that he would dislike.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'No one who has an atom’s weight of arrogance in his heart will enter Paradise.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Allah loves when one of you does a job, he does it with excellence (ihsan).'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever guarantees me what is between his jaws and between his legs, I guarantee him Paradise.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Fasting is a shield...'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'A woman was punished in Hell for imprisoning a cat...'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him honor his guest.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'A believer is not bitten from the same hole twice.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The best of people are those most beneficial to others.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The supplication made between the Adhan and Iqamah is not rejected.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The best day the sun rises over is Friday...'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'He who guides others to a good deed is like the one who does it.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Those who are merciful will be shown mercy by the Most Merciful.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'If a servant intends to do a good deed but does not do it, Allah writes it down as a complete good deed.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Islam is built on five pillars: Shahada, Salah, Zakah, Sawm, and Hajj.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Shall I not inform you of the biggest of the major sins? Associating partners with Allah, disobedience to parents, and false speech.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Beware! There is a piece of flesh in the body; if it becomes good, the whole body becomes good. That is the heart.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'None of you should wish for death... Let him say: O Allah, keep me alive as long as life is better for me, and take me if death is better for me.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Do not curse the wind, for it is from the mercy of Allah.'

The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Envy is permitted only in two cases: a man whom Allah has given the Qur’an and he recites it night and day, and a man whom Allah has given wealth and he spends it for His sake.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The best among you are those who have the best manners and character.'

The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Avoid the seven great destructive sins.' They asked: 'What are they?' He said: 'Associating others with Allah, sorcery, killing a soul, consuming interest, devouring orphan’s wealth, fleeing in battle, and slandering chaste women.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him maintain the ties of kinship.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Every act of kindness is charity.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'A good word is charity.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The upper hand is better than the lower hand.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The most beloved of deeds to Allah are those that are most consistent, even if small.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'No fatigue, illness, worry, grief, or distress befalls a Muslim, not even a thorn prick, except that Allah expiates some of his sins because of it.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The believer is not a slanderer, nor does he curse or speak in an obscene or foul manner.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever treads a path seeking knowledge, Allah will make easy for him the path to Paradise.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The best among you are those who are best to their families, and I am the best of you to my family.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'He who humbles himself for Allah, Allah will raise him.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Richness is not having many possessions, but richness is being content with oneself.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The most perfect of the believers in faith is he who is best of them in manners.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Every nation has a trial, and the trial of my nation is wealth.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'He who fasts during Ramadan with faith and seeking reward will have his past sins forgiven.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The most beloved words to Allah are four: SubhanAllah, Alhamdulillah, La ilaha illAllah, and Allahu Akbar.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever recites a letter from the Book of Allah will have a reward, and the reward will be multiplied tenfold.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Verily, the most hated speech to Allah is when a man says to another: Fear Allah, and he replies: Worry about yourself.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever defends the honor of his brother, Allah will protect his face from the Hellfire on the Day of Resurrection.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'It is sufficient evil for a person to look down on his Muslim brother.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Do not belittle any good deed, even meeting your brother with a cheerful face.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'There are two blessings which many people waste: health and free time.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'One who cuts off kinship ties will not enter Paradise.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Allah does not show mercy to him who is not merciful to people.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The nearest to me on the Day of Resurrection will be those who have the best manners.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever builds a mosque for Allah, Allah will build for him a house in Paradise.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'He who begins the day feeling secure in his home, healthy in his body, and having food for the day—it is as if he had the whole world.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Fear Allah wherever you are, follow up a bad deed with a good one, and behave well towards people.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'What is little but sufficient is better than that which is abundant and distracts.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'There is no Muslim who plants a tree or sows seeds, and then a bird or person or animal eats from it, except that it is charity for him.'

The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Do not wish to be like anyone except in two cases: a person whom Allah has given wealth and he spends it righteously, and one whom Allah has given wisdom and he acts according to it.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The best charity is giving water to drink.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'When one of you is angry, let him keep silent.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'If anyone cares for three daughters, disciplines them, marries them off, and does good to them, he will enter Paradise.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'If a woman prays her five, fasts her month, guards her chastity, and obeys her husband, she will enter Paradise from any door she wishes.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The best jihad is speaking a word of truth to a tyrant ruler.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'When Allah loves a servant, He calls Jibreel and says: Verily, I love so-and-so, so love him.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Beware! Every one of you is a shepherd, and every one is answerable for his flock.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The signs of a hypocrite are three: when he speaks, he lies; when he promises, he breaks it; and when he is trusted, he betrays the trust.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Pay the worker his wages before his sweat dries.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Do not say: “May Allah curse you!” for you do not know in what state you will die.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The most hated person to Allah is the most quarrelsome person.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Islam began as something strange and will return to being strange, so give glad tidings to the strangers.'
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Say what is true, even if it is bitter.'
